intro: Fimbristylis ochotensis, commonly known as the Ochotensis sedge, is a flowering plant species native to the temperate regions of East Asia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of streams, thriving in moist to waterlogged soils. Its slender, triangular stems are often covered with fine, hair-like structures, giving it a distinctive appearance. Fimbristylis ochotensis produces small, greenish flowers arranged in dense clusters, which are typically wind-pollinated.
